segments.text: The contrast between the calm garden outside and the chaos inside is striking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window is open, letting in sunlight, but the kitchen is a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water overflowing from the sink is just ridiculous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t imagine how much water has already spilled onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on drying that plate, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the kids are sneaking cookies like it’s a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I almost laugh at how oblivious everyone is to the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s stool is wobbling, and he doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the girl will catch him if he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is like a comedy of errors waiting to unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR
